summary: Build an NGO-related website for “डिजिटल भारत एकता संगठन” with provided Hindi welcome message, mission statement, goals, and values.
known_issues: Production deployment domain validation error when using Hindi/Devanagari characters in domain name (must be 5–50 chars, only letters/numbers/hyphens).
Version 7 deployment resulted in a completely blank website (production build issue or runtime error preventing React app from rendering).

existing_features.title: Create a responsive NGO website (single-page or simple multi-section layout) for “Digital Bharat Ekta Sangathan (डिजिटल भारत एकता संगठन)” with clear navigation to key sections: Welcome, Mission/What We Do, Goal, Values, and Contact.

Display the user-provided Hindi content verbatim in the Welcome/Mission area, including the quote, description of support beyond money, the goal “1,00,000 ईमानदार साथी”, and the values “एकता • पारदर्शिता • मानवता • न्याय”, plus the closing line “एकता से सशक्त भारत”.

Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme appropriate for an NGO (avoid blue/purple as the primary palette): define consistent typography, spacing, section backgrounds, and a calm, trustworthy color system across the entire site.

Add a Contact section with a simple contact form UI (name, email/phone, message) and clear disclaimer that submissions are not yet delivered (no backend integration), plus visible organization name in the footer.
Add generated static images to enhance the site’s presentation and render them from frontend/public/assets/generated (no backend image serving).
Add a new dedicated page section titled “₹1 सहयोग कैसे काम करता है?” and display the user-provided Hindi explanation text verbatim, preserving line breaks.

Add the new “₹1 सहयोग कैसे काम करता है?” section to the single-page flow and navigation: render it in the main page (App) and add a corresponding header navigation item that smooth-scrolls to the new section.

Store the new section’s title and body copy in the existing Hindi content source (frontend/src/content/hi.ts) as new fields, and have the new section component read from those fields (no hardcoded copy in the component).
Add a new single-page section for member registration, reachable via a header navigation item, using an on-page registration form (frontend-only UI).
Implement the member registration form UI with client-side validation and a clear disclaimer that submissions are not delivered/saved yet (no backend integration).
Update the organization name in frontend/src/content/hi.ts from 'डिजिटल भारत एकता संगठन' to 'जन कल्याण संगठन'
Update any English transliteration or romanized references to reflect 'Jan Kalyan Sangathan' instead of 'Digital Bharat Ekta Sangathan'
Update the organization name in frontend/src/content/hi.ts from 'जन कल्याण संगठन' to 'जन कल्याण एकता संगठन'
Update the English transliteration in frontend/index.html title from 'Jan Kalyan Sangathan' to 'Jan Kalyan Ekta Sangathan'
Update any romanized references in comments or documentation from 'Jan Kalyan Sangathan' to 'Jan Kalyan Ekta Sangathan' to maintain consistency
Create React Query hooks in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts for member registration submission and fetching member statistics

Update MemberRegistrationSection component to integrate with backend: submit form data to backend, display success confirmation with member ID, show error messages, and remove the 'submissions not saved' disclaimer
Add a success confirmation message in Hindi to content/hi.ts for member registration that includes placeholders for member ID and confirmation text

Create a password-protected admin dashboard page at /admin route that displays registered members in a table format with columns for member ID, name, email, phone number, district/state, and registration date
Implement search and filter functionality in the admin dashboard to allow filtering members by name, email, phone number, district, or state
Add export functionality to the admin dashboard that allows downloading member data as CSV file with all registration fields
Display registration statistics in the admin dashboard showing total member count, members registered today, members registered this week, and members registered this month
Add member management panel to the admin dashboard with functionality to edit member records including name, email, phone number, district/state, and message fields
Add delete functionality to the admin dashboard allowing administrators to remove member records with confirmation dialog before deletion
Add bulk notification feature to the admin dashboard with ability to compose and send messages to selected members or all members
Add status management controls to the admin dashboard allowing administrators to change member status between 'active', 'inactive', and 'pending' with dropdown selection
Create React Query hooks in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts for admin operations including updateMember mutation, deleteMember mutation, and time-based statistics queries
Implement pagination controls in the admin dashboard to handle large numbers of members with configurable page size and page navigation

Investigate and fix the root cause of the blank page in production by checking for runtime errors in the React application, ensuring all imports and dependencies are correctly resolved, and verifying that the root element mounting in frontend/src/main.tsx is working properly
Verify that frontend/src/App.tsx correctly configures TanStack Router with both the home (/) and admin (/admin) routes and that the RouterProvider is properly wrapped with QueryClientProvider

Ensure all component imports in frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx and frontend/src/pages/AdminDashboard.tsx resolve correctly and that no circular dependencies or missing modules cause the application to fail
Verify that the backend actor initialization in frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts completes successfully and does not block the application from rendering if the actor creation fails or is pending
Add error boundary component to catch and display React rendering errors instead of showing a blank page, with a user-friendly error message and option to reload the page

new_feature_requests.summary: Create NGO website for “डिजिटल भारत एकता संगठन” featuring Hindi welcome/mission content, goals (1,00,000 ईमानदार साथी), and values (एकता, पारदर्शिता, मानवता, न्याय).

Add a dedicated “₹1 सहयोग कैसे काम करता है?” section and display the user-provided Hindi explanation text verbatim (1,00,000 people × ₹1 = ₹1,00,000; used for one needy person’s financial/administrative help within legal limits; not charity—mutual support).

Add a Help/Complaint submission section (form fields: Name, Mobile Number, District/State, Issue Type, Short Description, Evidence if any) and display the disclaimer: “बिना सत्य जानकारी के किसी भी मामले पर कार्रवाई नहीं होगी।”
Add a ‘विचारधारा’/Ideology section highlighting the lines: “संगठन आवाज़ है, अदालत नहीं” and “संगठन मार्गदर्शन है, टकराव नहीं”.
Add a member registration option (member signup/registration UI).
Update organization name to 'जन कल्याण एकता संगठन' in Hindi content
Add backend functionality to member registration form: save member data securely, send confirmation messages, enable member database management and authentication/login.
Create a Motoko backend data model to store member registration information including name, phone number, email, district/state, and message fields with appropriate data types and timestamps
Implement a backend method to register new members that accepts member details, validates required fields, generates unique member ID, stores the data, and returns confirmation with the member ID
Implement a backend method to retrieve all registered members with pagination support for administrative access
Implement a backend method to retrieve member count for dashboard statistics
Generate migration.mo to handle upgrade from empty backend state to new member storage structure
Create password-protected admin dashboard page to view registered members in a table, search/filter members, export member data, and display registration statistics
Add member management panel with features to edit/delete member records, send bulk notifications, and track member status
Implement backend query methods to support time-based member statistics: getMembersRegisteredToday, getMembersRegisteredThisWeek, and getMembersRegisteredThisMonth
Implement backend update method to modify existing member records by member ID with validation to ensure member exists before updating
Implement backend delete method to remove member records by member ID from storage
Add member status tracking to the registration data model with status field supporting values: 'active', 'inactive', 'pending'
